Nsp3 is the largest protein encoded by CoVs (~200 kDa). In SARS-CoVs it has 16 domains which include a papain-like proteolytic enzyme from the cysteine protease class (C16 family and CA clan for SARS-CoV).

83 PL pro is composed of a catalytic domain, an extended right-handed thumb-palm-finger structure with a Cys-His-Asp catalytic triad, and a ubiquitin-like domain (Ubl) ( Fig. 5A). The catalytic Cys is located in the thumb subdomain while His and Asp in the palm subdomain ( Fig. 5B). PL pro catalyses the hydrolysis reaction of peptide bonds of pp1a/pp1ab at three sites (Nsp1/Nsp2, Nsp2/Nsp3 and Nsp3/Nsp4) that share the XLXGG* pattern (*represents the cleavage site).
